thread.title: Birmingham fans react angrily to Facebook photos of evening with Gianfranco Zola while terrible run continues
thread.title_full: Birmingham fans react angrily to Facebook photos of evening with Gianfranco Zola while terrible run continues

author: Jim Daly
title: Birmingham fans react angrily to Facebook photos of evening with Gianfranco Zola while terrible run continues
text:
Birmingham fans react angrily to Facebook photos of evening with Gianfranco Zola while terrible run continues "Whoever is in charge of PR at the minute is doing a worse job than Zola" Share Birmingham fans were not happy with the timing of a meet-and-greet with boss Zola (Photo: Getty Images Europe) Share Get football   Thank you for subscribing!   
Birmingham City might regret putting a photo on Facebook of under-fire boss Gianfranco Zola enjoying a night meeting fans 
The Italian has just one win in 14 games since arriving after the shock sacking of Gary Rowett in December, with the Blues languishing in 16th place in the Championship. 
But on Tuesday night the former Chelsea star and West Ham boss attended a function in his honour where he met fans and commercial partners. 
Photos from the night were uploaded to Birmingham's official Facebook account with Zola smiling alongside fans and the caption "It's been an excellent evening with Gianfranco and his staff." 
Bluenoses, however, were NOT happy and the backlash began in the comments section. 
Paul Smart said: "Whoever is in charge of PR at the minute is doing a worse job than Zola." 
Andy Armstrong added: "Isn't that just lovely. Who cares about performances on the pitch, just as long as you're all having an excellent evening." 
Tracey Finlay snarked: "Of course it's been an excellent night, there was no bloody football being played !!!" 
Andrew Clark said :"Awww that's cute. Perhaps you could give blues fans something to smile about? You seem happy enough to take our money." 
Jason Lenny Facey added: "Been an excellent evening with zola has it ?? Why is that, did he resign ?" 
While angry David Wood quipped: " said a single Blues fan as the final whistle blew, like NEVER!" Zola has just one win in 14 games since arriving after the shock sacking of Gary Rowett in December (Photo: Getty Images Europe) 
Zola has told the Birmingham board, however, that he is prepared to tough it out at St Andrew . 
He faces a tricky trip next to local rivals Wolves on Friday night with mounting concern from fans at his reign, with his side most recently on the end of a4-1 home thumping by struggling QPR. 
Zola has tried and failed to change Blues' style midway through the campaign to a more passing game since succeeding Rowett in December. 
But Chinese owner Paul Suen is sticking by the Chelsea legend after taking control of the Championship club four months ago. Video Loading Click to play Tap to play The video will start in 8 Cancel Play now
